text: Alright!!! And can I move my template pages to the new HubSpot CMS?
All landing pages and site pages built on HubSpot are built on the HubSpot CMS. If you have say marketing hub, the difference is CMS Hub specifically enables creation of full fledged websites.
Actually I have already created many web pages in HubSpot but right now I am unable to move those pages to HubSpot theme.
I have created HubSpot theme blank folder and trying to move my web pages into that but it's disable
So I wonder do I have to develo web pages from scratch for theme or what? css, modules, js all I can move but not web pages.

Pages can use a theme but are not addable to a theme. 

Templates and modules and coded files are what you add to a theme

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes>

I have gone through with this article. I am stuck here is that I have created many website pages like home, about, career, etc and now if I am editing my websites pages I am unable to edit my custom modules within the pages similar like in this article.
mind DMing me a design manager link to your theme? That will help ensure we’re on the same page. (I work for HubSpot, I can view it if shared to me)
<https://www.loom.com/share/86716cefc4ff4fb58e12be71a04c0894>
Have a look from my custom module I am trying to select the text and change that but I am unable to edit it within the page
These are the custom module created by use. We can change the text frmo left side panel but unable to edit it within the page similar like showing in article.
Even I can't able to see the grid section.

editing the text in the page itself is a feature of just the rich text module. For custom modules they don’t yet support that. You must edit those in the left pane.

It appears you did not use a drag and drop area, and that would be why you don’t see the grid and have the ability to re-arrange.
<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas|designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas>
Oh really???
I was literally in tension that what will happen with my custom modules if drag and drop will not support. I invested a lot of time to develop it.

I have developed many custom modules and I need to allow to user that they can add and remove from this page only. But add and design both options are not available for my pages. <https://www.loom.com/share/83a0ef891e2a45b7a8e4c380fb7c0b12>

I apologize that there may be a  communication issue. I interpret your above message as meaning you built your modules with the intent that they would be used with drag and drop.

If that is your meaning. The modules themselves can be used in flexible columns and drag and drop areas.

The templates themselves need to have drag and drop areas or flexible columns to do that.
You are absolutely right but still I can't see the option to adjust the column
You won’t see that until you add the drag and drop area

This page shows how you add a drag and drop area to a page
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas>
I advise you look over the first link I gave you though first because you will want to understand the concepts first.
Ok I understood
We have developed same like that and we are able to drag and drap through the Design Tool
Is there any functionality available to drag and drop with the page pages
From here
There appears to be a communication issue. I’m not sure what you’re meaning by “drag and drop with the pages pages”
Swaping the module
Currently text section is on left side and image section is on right side
So can I swap from here only
Text section on right and image section on left
If you have a drag and drop area, yes, you can swap them
For custom module I am unable to swap
Are they within a drag and drop area? if not you can’t swap them. Your template needs to have a drag and drop area, and those modules need to be in it.
Yes they are
have a look here
Everything is in drag and drop area only

Okay you are not using a drag and drop area. That is a drag and drop template. Apologize that the name is so similar, we realize that causes confusion. See the warning on this page about drag and drop templates <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates>
:disappointed_relieved:
This add up a lot more work for me...
Neverthless, I am clear about all my doubts.
Thank you so much to keep patience with me.I really appreciate. You are awesome. :+1:
One last thing, from where do I get subscribe to get notify for the developer latest updates.

No problem, sorry that the misunderstanding caused you extra work.

to subscribe to HubSpot developer related changes  our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developer changelog> is the best place to go.

We also have our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog|developer blog>.
Can we develop mega menu in HubSpot? Is there any way?

Yes, there are two primary ways developers tend to build mega menus. Generally speaking developers build them as modules, then either store the menu structure as a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/menus-and-navigation|navigation menu>, and use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#menu|menu()> or use HubDB for a fully custom structure.
